label: Description
value: Bottom of bowl on outside decorated with loops and acanthus leaves in relief. Upper portion decorated by friezes of triglyph-like rectangles, repeating loops of acanthus and one taper of mercarous on drapery.  Rich torus moulding at top and at top of cavetto pedestal, which rests on square base.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1923: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description

With a tortoiseshell thumbguard and a glass stone at the rivet, threaded with leather ribbon.

label: Description

In center, a pair of cupids; to right, Venus dispatches Cupid; to left, Venus decorating Cupid with flowers on his return. Sticks pierced, painted in gouache with garlands of flowers.
